summary: This is an amended application and supporting affidavit by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking a second warrant and order for prospective and historical cellphone location information and pen register data for a phone believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. The document corrects errors in a previous application and supports the request with facts establishing probable cause for Maxwell's arrest on charges related to the sexual exploitation of minors.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submits the amended application for the warrant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the target of the investigation, indicted for conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. The warrant seeks location data for a cellphone subscribed to 'G Max', believed to be used by her.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Her phone was in contact with the target cellphone in or about May 2020. She is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell shares a joint bank account and to whom her Amazon account has sent packages. His phone was in contact with the target cellphone in or about March 2020.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. Her phone was in contact with the target cellphone within the last 30 days.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: She granted the original warrant application on June 29, 2020, and is the judge before whom the amended affidavit is sworn.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: She signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

connections.description: Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister. Their phones were in contact as of May 2020.
They share a joint bank account and her Amazon account has sent multiple packages to him within approximately the last year.
Laura Menninger is an attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation.
The law firm Haddon, Morgan, & Foreman represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. The target phone was in contact with a phone subscribed to the firm.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant Issued for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed an arrest warrant for her.

events.title: Original Warrant for Cellphone Data Granted
events.description: Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker granted the government's original application for a warrant to obtain cellphone location and pen register information for the target phone.

events.title: Submission of Amended Application
events.description: The government submitted this amended application and affidavit to correct two inadvertent errors in the original agent affidavit regarding contact dates with phones associated with Isabel Maxwell and Scott Borgerson.

events.title: Last Contact with Isabel Maxwell Phone
events.description: The target cellphone was most recently in contact with the phone subscribed to Isabel Maxwell.

events.title: Last Contact with Scott Borgerson Phone
events.description: The target cellphone was most recently in contact with the phone subscribed to Scott Borgerson.

keyFacts: The FBI is seeking a second warrant to track a cellphone subscribed to 'G Max', believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell, who was indicted on June 29, 2020, for crimes related to the sexual exploitation of minors.

The application corrects errors in a previous affidavit, noting the target phone's last contact with Isabel Maxwell's phone was in May 2020 (not within 30 days) and with Scott Borgerson's phone was in March 2020 (not within 30 days).
The target phone had recent contact (within 30 days) with phones associated with Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys at the law firm Haddon, Morgan, & Foreman and attorney Laura Menninger.

The government requests the warrant and supporting documents be sealed and the service provider (AT&T) be prohibited from notifying the subscriber for one year to prevent flight, witness intimidation, or evidence destruction.
The requested data includes 45 days of prospective location/GPS data, historical cell site data from June 1, 2020, and pen register information for 45 days.
